Class PatternMatcher

  |

All Implemented Interfaces:
PatternHandler
public class PatternMatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements PatternHandler

Implementation of the PatternHandler interface using the JDK 1.4 package java.util.regex.

Author:
Heiko Blau

Method Detail

hasPattern

public boolean hasPattern()
The method is a dummy implementation for the interface PatternHandler and always returns true.

Specified by:
hasPattern in interface PatternHandler
Returns:
always true

matches

public TokenizerProperty matches(DataProvider dataProvider,
                                 boolean freePatternOnly,
                                 int[] lengthOfMatch)
                          throws TokenizerException,
                                 java.lang.NullPointerException
This method checks if the start of a character range given through the DataProvider matches a pattern. See PatternHandler.matches(de.susebox.jtopas.spi.DataProvider, boolean, int[]) for details.

Specified by:
matches in interface PatternHandler
Parameters:
dataProvider - the source to get the data from
freePatternOnly - if true only unbounded pattern should be checked (pattern not enclosed in whitespaces, separators etc.)
lengthOfMatch - if a match is found, the method places the length of it into the first element of this array
Returns:
a TokenizerProperty object or null if no match was found
Throws:
TokenizerException - generic exception
java.lang.NullPointerException - if no DataProvider is given

setProperty

public void setProperty(TokenizerProperty prop)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Setting the TokenizerProperty for this PatternMatcher. This method will recompile the regular expression pattern.

Parameters:
prop - the TokenizerProperty associated with this object
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given parameter is null

getProperty

public TokenizerProperty getProperty()
Retrieving the TokenizerProperty of this PatternMatcher.

Returns:
the TokenizerProperty associated with this object
